abstract: Stock markets rewarded companies like Johnson & Johnson and Cisco that made acquisitions in the months after Lehman Brothers‘ collapse, a study showed.
snippet: Stock markets rewarded companies like Johnson & Johnson and Cisco that made acquisitions in the months after Lehman Brothers‘ collapse, a study showed.
lead_paragraph: Stock markets rewarded companies like Johnson & Johnson and Cisco that were brave enough to make acquisitions in the months after Lehman Brothers‘ collapse, a study released Monday showed.

headline.main: In Post-Lehman Deals, Fortune Favored the Brave
